intro: Rawsonia spinidens, commonly known as the spiked rawsonia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive spiny stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in shrubland or rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
